<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ELLOW</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">HAREHOLDERS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">:</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2010, the Kroger team continued to grow our business and reward our Shareholders in a difficult economic and operating environment. We also further strengthened our position as the leading traditional grocery retailer in the U.S. Kroger&#8217;s competitive strengths include:</font></div>

<ul style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Significant scale</font></font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">.</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Today we operate more than 2,400 retail grocery stores and multi-department stores in 31 states, plus over 1,000 supermarket fuel locations and more than 700 convenience stores. </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Total sales in 2010 were a record-breaking $82.2 billion</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Strong and growing market share</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">. </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Kroger holds the #1 or #2 share in 38 of our 42 major markets;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Offering a</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">personalized approach</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">to each Customer, based on the proprietary consumer insights we gain from our partnership with dunnhumbyUSA. This unique advantage helped Kroger grow both our number of loyal households and total households that shop with us;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Industry-leading identical supermarket sales growth</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">. </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">While many major grocery competitors experienced negative identical-sales trends in 2010 and recent years, Kroger has delivered positive identical sales, excluding fuel, for </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">29 consecutive quarters</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">A</font> consistent record of rewarding Shareholders</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">through</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">dividends and share repurchases; and<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A strong balance sheet </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal">with</font> significant financial flexibility</font></font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">2010 Highlights</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Kroger&#8217;s Customer 1st strategy focuses on people, prices, service, selection, and shopping experience. The 338,000 Associates who bring this strategy to life prove every day that this combination is winning with Customers. Total 2010 sales increased 7.1 percent to $82.2 billion, and net earnings were $1.12 billion, or $1.74 per diluted share. This compares with 2009 total sales of $76.7 billion and reported net earnings of $70.0 million, or $0.11 per diluted share in 2009. Excluding the effect of the non-cash impairment charges taken in the third quarter of 2009, net earnings in the prior year would have been $1.12 billion, or $1.71 per diluted share.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Significant scale.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">One measure of the success of Kroger&#8217;s Customer 1st strategy is our unparalleled reach within the regions in which we operate. Approximately one-half of all U.S. households have a Kroger loyalty card. Looking specifically at the markets where Kroger operates, nearly 85 percent of households hold a Kroger loyalty card and have shopped with us during the last year. Each and every one of our cardholders benefits from Kroger&#8217;s unique combination of value, selection, service, and convenience just by being a Kroger shopper.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We believe in giving our Customers choices. Therefore, Kroger offers both a full complement of national brands and the most robust store-brand portfolio in the industry. Strong growth in Kroger&#8217;s Corporate Brand products continued across all three categories in 2010: Private Selection, our premium brands; Banner Brands like Kroger, Ralphs and King Soopers, which represent the majority of our own Corporate Brands; and Value brand items, aimed at our most price-sensitive Customers. Kroger&#8217;s 40 manufacturing plants supplied about 40 percent of the Corporate Brand units sold. During 2010, these Corporate Brands accounted for approximately one-third of Kroger&#8217;s total grocery unit sales.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1</font></font></div>
</div>

&#160;&#160; <br>
<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify">&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Strong and growing market share.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our fundamental Customer 1st strategy continues to deliver positive market share results. We increased market share in 2010 by an estimated 80 basis points across 19 major marketing areas, according to Nielsen Homescan Data. More specifically, where Walmart supercenters are our primary competitor, we grew market share by 75 basis points in 17 of 19 major markets compared to the previous year. Our Associates&#8217; dedication to satisfying one Customer at a time helps the Kroger family of stores compete effectively with retailers who sell both consumables and groceries.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Kroger serves our Customers&#8217; everyday needs for groceries and so much more. We offer discounts on fuel, convenient pharmacies with $4 and $10 generic drugs, The Little Clinic locations for everyday illnesses and physicals, and an abundance of gift cards. We have special cell phone offerings through i-wireless, healthy restaurant-quality take-home meals, and outstanding selections of seasonal floral, home d&#233;cor, and celebration items. Kroger also offers our unique 1-2-3 Rewards MasterCard. This is one of the many products from Kroger Personal Finance that give our customers even more savings and rewards for their purchases, including items bought outside Kroger with the 1-2-3 Rewards MasterCard.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We now have more than 1,000 supermarket fuel centers and over 1,900 pharmacies. By offering fuel savings and $4 and $10 generics &#8211; along with everyday savings and benefits from our loyalty program &#8211; we encourage our Customers to visit Kroger for all of their groceries, health and beauty products, prescriptions, other household items, and fuel.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Proprietary consumer insights are driving strong customer loyalty.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Kroger&#8217;s strategic partnership with dunnhumbyUSA helps us to continue to build our loyal household base. dunnhumbyUSA is a global leader in data management, customer analysis, and insight-led planning. Through the unique customer insights Kroger gains from our loyalty data, we are able to offer unparalleled personalized marketing plans that reward our most loyal Customers with greater value for the products they like and buy regularly.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In 2010, our number of loyal households continued to increase, as did the number of their store visits. Total households shopping at our stores also increased year over year. As a result of the combination of higher household counts and more visits per household, we generated positive identical sales for both loyal and total households in 2010.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Industry leading identical sales growth.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Our strong 2010 results are the outcome of our consistent approach to managing Kroger&#8217;s business and executing our Customer 1st strategy, which creates a powerful connection with a broad range of shoppers. We focus on identical sales growth, excluding fuel, because it powers our business model and generates earnings and free cash flow that reward our Shareholders. Identical supermarket sales increased in 2010 by 2.8 percent, excluding fuel. Quarter after quarter of positive identical sales growth distinguishes Kroger from many other retailers. In fact, Kroger has produced positive identical sales for 29 consecutive quarters. We continued to have positive tonnage growth in the fiscal year on top of strong results in the prior year. Our promotional and pricing strategies are designed to deliver sustainable results by building long-term customer loyalty and expanding our competitive advantage.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2</font></font></div>
</div>

&#160;&#160; <br>
<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify">&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Consistent record of rewarding Shareholders.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2010, we achieved solid positive identical supermarket sales and market share growth, which demonstrates that we can strengthen our business and reward shareholders by placing our customers&#8217; needs first. Kroger&#8217;s return to our Shareholders has been strong. Our total payout to Shareholders during the past five years (combining dividends and share repurchases) has averaged nearly 70 percent of net income. In fiscal 2010, for example, Kroger repurchased $545 million of our Common Shares, on top of share repurchases of $218 million in 2009 and $637 million in 2008. That&#8217;s more than $1.1 billion of share repurchases during the last three years, and more than $6.4 billion since January 2000. And, on March 3, 2011, Kroger announced that our Board of Directors had authorized an additional $1 billion share repurchase program.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We also paid dividends of $250 million in fiscal 2010, increasing the dividends paid to Shareholders in each of the years since we began paying a dividend in 2006. During the last five years, Kroger has paid more than $1.0 billion in dividends to our Shareholders. We&#8217;ve been able to accomplish this while maintaining our investment-grade credit rating and reducing long-term debt and annual interest expense.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Strong balance sheet with significant flexibility.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Kroger&#8217;s BBB investment-grade credit rating gives us significant financial flexibility. During 2010, Kroger reduced net total debt by $243.5 million, to $7.3 billion. In addition, at the end of fiscal 2010, our net total debt to EBITDA ratio, adjusted for the impairment charges in fiscal 2010 and 2009, was 1.89 compared with 1.97 at the end of fiscal 2009.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Living our Mission and Values</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Safety</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Safety is one of our core values. As a result of our Associates&#8217; engagement in our safety programs, Kroger has reduced the accident rates in stores and plants by 74 percent during the past 15 years. We continue to make steady progress toward our goal of zero accidents.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Partnering with our Customers and Associates to serve our communities.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We have the privilege of touching the lives of millions of Customers daily in our 2,458 supermarkets, 786 convenience stores and 361 jewelry stores. Kroger is proud to partner with our Associates and Customers to help improve the communities in which we live and work. We are especially focused on helping Feeding America and more than 80 community organizations that feed the hungry. During the past five years, Kroger has donated the equivalent of 560 million meals to local food banks.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The winners of The Kroger Co. Community Service Award for 2010 are listed after this letter. Their hard work and dedication are appreciated by us all, and we encourage all of our Associates to get involved in the communities where we work and live.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Sustainability is a major focus.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Kroger continues to make important progress on our sustainability agenda. We encourage you to read our latest sustainability report, which is available at www.thekrogerco.com.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3</font></font></div>
</div>

&#160;&#160; <br>
<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Executive Changes</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We note with deep sadness the unexpected passing on February 16, 2011 of our colleague, friend, and company executive, Donald E. Becker. Don was Kroger&#8217;s Executive Vice President since 2004. In that role, he led merchandising, marketing, and procurement.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Don began his career with Kroger in 1969 as a clerk in the stores in Cincinnati where he met his future wife. In his 42 years with the Company, Don held many leadership positions including Vice President of the Cincinnati/Dayton division and President of Kroger&#8217;s Central division.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Don was a &#8220;people person&#8221; who touched many lives. He was an avid promoter of diversity, and a mentor and friend to many.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>On February 22, 2011, more than 1,600 associates and friends gathered at the Duke Energy Convention Center to celebrate Don&#8217;s life in reflection, song, and meditation. Our Company&#8217;s success has been -- and will continue to be -- deeply influenced by Don&#8217;s unwavering focus on the Customer, his merchandising brilliance, and his abiding passion for people.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">* * * * * * * * * * * *</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In 2010, Kroger announced several retirements, promotions and appointments at the corporate and division levels.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Paul J. Scutt, Senior Vice President for Retail Operations, retired after 45 years with The Kroger Co. Paul began as a store clerk with Kroger in 1965. He left the Company to spend two years in the Army, serving in Vietnam for 15 months. Upon returning from the military and earning his college degree, Paul entered Kroger&#8217;s management training program. Paul quickly rose through the Company&#8217;s operations and merchandising positions, including Vice President of Dillon Companies (1997) and President of Kroger&#8217;s Central division (2000) based in Indianapolis. In his role as Senior Vice President of Retail Operations, Kroger significantly reduced employee accidents, improved management of product shrink and operating costs, and instituted process changes that have allowed the Company to invest in our Customer 1st Strategy.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Della Wall, Group Vice President for Human Resources, retired after 39 years with Kroger. Kathleen S. Barclay was elected an officer of the Company and Senior Vice President for Human Resources in late 2009. Ms. Barclay joined Kroger after serving as the Global Human Resources executive for General Motors. Carver L. Johnson, who served as Kroger&#8217;s first Chief Diversity Officer, retired from the Company. John E. Bays, President of the Dillon Stores&#160;division, retired after 42 with the Company. Joseph A. Grieshaber, Jr. was appointed President of the Dillon Stores&#160;division, replacing Mr. Bays. Phyllis J. Norris, President of City Market, retired after 36 years with the Company.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Jeffrey D. Burt was promoted to Group Vice President of Perishables. Geoffrey J. Covert, President of the Cincinnati/Dayton division, was elected an officer of the Company and was promoted to Senior Vice President, Retail Operations. Bryan H. Kaltenbach was promoted to President of the Food 4 Less division. Sukanya R. Madlinger was promoted to President of the Cincinnati/Dayton division.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>These men and women helped make Kroger a better place to shop and work, and we greatly appreciate their contributions.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4</font></font></div>
</div>

&#160;&#160; <br>
<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Best in Class Retailer &#8211; Long-Term Goals</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our objective is to create value for Shareholders at industry leadership levels. More specifically, our goals are to:</font></div>

<ul style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Continue to grow sales and loyal households through execution of our Customer 1st strategy;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Expand earnings through steady identical sales growth together with modest growth in operating margins, without fuel;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Target annual earnings per share growth averaging 6 to 8 percent over a rolling 3- to 5-year horizon;<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Achieve a total shareholder return of 8 to 10 percent, including our dividend; and<br>
&#160; </font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Generate an average annual return for Shareholders that matches or exceeds the S&amp;P 500, with less volatility.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">These are ambitious long-term goals. When I travel and visit our stores, Kroger Associates tell me they are inspired by what we can accomplish together. They believe in Customer 1st and see the results.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>While we are encouraged by the Company&#8217;s recent performance, I do not want to imply that we are satisfied. We still have significant opportunities for improvement. We need to continue our disciplined cost reductions and take more costs </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">out</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> of our business so we can invest more </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">in</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> areas that drive profitable growth.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>We also know there are challenges ahead for 2011 and beyond, including, an economic recovery that is weaker and slower than we hoped; customers who are concerned about rising fuel and food costs; continued high unemployment that is holding back consumer confidence; and rising pension and healthcare costs that we all must address together.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Even with these challenges and others, I am confident in Kroger and our future. We have all the elements of success in place: outstanding Associates who are engaged in serving every Customer; a convenient and updated store base; passionate and seasoned leaders in stores, offices and facilities at every level of the company; a strong balance sheet and financial position; and a robust operating strategy that is working.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>It is my privilege to be a part of our dedicated team that I believe is the best in the industry. On behalf of all of us, thank you for your continued support and interest in Kroger.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<img src="kroger_def14a1x7x1.jpg"> <br>
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">David B. Dillon<br>
</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Chairman of the Board and<br>
Chief Executive Officer</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">5</font></font></div>
</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OTICE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OF </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NNUAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> M</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">EETING</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">HAREHOLDERS</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="right"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cincinnati, Ohio, May 13, 2011</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">To All Shareholders of The Kroger Co.:</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The annual meeting of shareholders of The Kroger Co. will be held at the MUSIC HALL BALLROOM, MUSIC HALL, 1241 Elm Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202, on June 23, 2011, at 11 a.m., eastern time, for the following purposes:</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">

<td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></td>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">all as set forth in the Proxy Statement accompanying this Notice. Holders of common shares of record at the close of business on April 25, 2011, will be entitled to vote at the meeting.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">TTENDANCE</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Only shareholders and persons holding proxies from shareholders may attend the meeting. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">If you are attending the meeting, please bring the notice of the meeting that was separately mailed to you or the top portion of your proxy card, either of which will serve as your admission ticket.</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>YOUR MANAGEMENT DESIRES TO HAVE A LARGE NUMBER OF SHAREHOLDERS REPRESENTED AT THE MEETING, IN PERSON OR BY PROXY. PLEASE VOTE YOUR PROXY ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE INTERNET OR BY TELEPHONE. IF YOU HAVE ELECTED TO RECEIVE PRINTED MATERIALS, YOU MAY SIGN AND DATE THE PROXY AND MAIL IT IN THE SELF-ADDRESSED ENVELOPE PROVIDED. NO POSTAGE IS REQUIRED IF MAILED WITHIN THE UNITED STATES.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>If you are unable to attend the annual meeting, you may listen to a live webcast of the meeting, which will be accessible through our website, www.thekrogerco.com, at 11 a.m., eastern time.</font></div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">7</font></font></div>
</div>

&#160;&#160; <br>
<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ROXY&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">TATEMENT</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="right"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cincinnati, Ohio, May 13, 2011</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Your proxy is solicited by the Board of Directors of The Kroger Co., and the cost of solicitation will be borne by Kroger. We will reimburse banks, brokers, nominees, and other fiduciaries for postage and reasonable expenses incurred by them in forwarding the proxy material to their principals. Kroger has retained D.F. King &amp; Co., Inc., 48 Wall Street, New York, New York, to assist in the solicitation of proxies and will pay that firm a fee estimated at present not to exceed $15,000. Proxies may be solicited personally, by telephone, electronically via the Internet, or by mail.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>David B. Dillon, John T. LaMacchia, and Bobby S. Shackouls, all of whom are Kroger directors, have been named members of the Proxy Committee.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The principal executive offices of The Kroger Co. are located at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100. Our telephone number is 513-762-4000. This Proxy Statement and Annual Report, and the accompanying proxy, were first furnished to shareholders on May 13, 2011.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>As of the close of business on April 25, 2011, our outstanding voting securities consisted of 606,471,857 common shares, the holders of which will be entitled to one vote per share at the annual meeting. The shares represented by each proxy will be voted unless the proxy is revoked before it is exercised. Revocation may be in writing to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary, or in person at the meeting, or by appointment of a subsequent proxy. Shareholders may not cumulate votes in the election of directors.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The effect of broker non-votes and abstentions on matters presented for shareholder vote is as follows:</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 1, Election of Directors</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> &#8211; An affirmative majority of the total number of votes cast &#8220;for&#8221; or &#8220;against&#8221; a director nominee is required for election. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 2, Approval of 2011 Long-Term Incentive and Cash Bonus Plan</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> &#8211; Approval by shareholders of the Plan requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 3, Advisory vote on executive compensation</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> &#8211; Approval by shareholders of executive compensation requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 4, Advisory vote on the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> &#8211; The option, be it every one, two, or three years, that receives the highest number of votes cast by shareholders will represent the vote on frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 5, Selection of Auditors</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> &#8211; Ratification by shareholders of the selection of independent public accountants requires the affirmative vote of the majority of shares participating in the voting. Accordingly, abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 6, Shareholder Proposal </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#8211; The affirmative vote of a majority of shares participating in the voting on a shareholder proposal is required for its adoption. Proxies will be voted AGAINST this proposal unless the Proxy Committee is otherwise instructed on a proxy properly executed and returned. Broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">8</font></font></div>
</div>

&#160;&#160; <br>
<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ROPOSALS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">TO</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">HAREHOLDERS</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">LECTION </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">IRECTORS<br>
</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">TEM</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">. 1)</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Board of Directors, as now authorized, consists of fourteen members. All members are to be elected at the annual meeting to serve until the annual meeting in 2012, or until their successors have been elected by the shareholders or by the Board of Directors pursuant to Kroger&#8217;s Regulations, and qualified. Kroger&#8217;s Articles of Incorporation provide that the vote required for election of a director by the shareholders, except in a contested election or when cumulative voting is in effect, will be the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast for or against the election of a nominee.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The experience, qualifications, attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance Committee and the Board to conclude that the following individuals should serve as directors are set forth opposite each individual&#8217;s name. The committee memberships stated below are those in effect as of the date of this proxy statement. It is intended that, except to the extent that authority is withheld, proxies will be voted for the election of the following persons:</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

She is a member of the Audit and Public Responsibilities Committees.</font></div>

She was inducted into the YWCA Academy of Women Achievers.</font></div>

<td nowrap width="75%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Professional<br>

<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Age</font></font></td>
<td nowrap width="3%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Director<br>
</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Since</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">David B. Lewis</font></font></font></font></div>

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" width="75%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Mr. Lewis is Chairman of Lewis &amp; Munday, a Detroit based law firm with offices in Washington, D.C., Seattle, and New York City. He is a director of H&amp;R Block and STERIS Corporation. Previously, Mr. Lewis has served on the Board of Directors of Conrail, Inc., LG&amp;E Energy Corp., Lewis &amp; Thompson Agency, Inc., M.A. Hanna, TRW, Inc., and Comerica, Inc. He is a member of the Financial Policy Committee and vice chair of the Public Responsibilities Committee.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">In addition to his background as a practicing attorney and expertise in bond financing, Mr. Lewis brings to Kroger&#8217;s Board his financial background gained while earning his MBA in Finance as well as his service and leadership on Kroger&#8217;s and other audit committees. He is a former chairman of the National Association of Securities Professionals.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">66</font></td>

Prior to that he was elected Vice Chairman in 2003, Executive Vice President in 1999, and Senior Vice President in 1997. Mr. McMullen is a director of Cincinnati Financial Corporation.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Mr. McMullen has broad experience in the supermarket business, having spent his career spanning over 30 years with Kroger. He has a strong financial background and played a major role as architect of Kroger&#8217;s strategic plan. Mr. McMullen is actively involved in the day-to-day operations of Kroger. His service on the compensation, executive, and investment committees of Cincinnati Financial Corporation adds depth to his extensive retail experience.</font></div>

<td width="2%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Age</font></font></td>
<td width="5%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Director<br>

<td align="center" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" style="PADDING-LEFT: 0pt">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Susan M. Phillips</font></font></div>
</td>
<td align="center" valign="top" width="73%">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Dr. Phillips is Professor of Finance at The George Washington University School of Business, a position she has held since 1998. She retired as Dean of that School of Business as of June 30, 2010. She was a member of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System from December 1991 through June 1998. Before her Federal Reserve appointment, Dr. Phillips served as Vice President for Finance and University Services and Professor of Finance in The College of Business Administration at the University of Iowa from 1987 through 1991. She is a director of CBOE Holdings, Inc., State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Company, State Farm Life Insurance Company, State Farm Companies Foundation, National Futures Association, and the Chicago Board Options Exchange. Dr. Phillips also was a trustee of the Financial Accounting Foundation until the end of 2010. She is a member of the Audit and Financial Policy Committees.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Dr. Phillips brings to the Board strong financial acumen, along with a deep understanding of, and involvement with, the relationship between corporations and the government. Her experience in academia brings a unique and diverse viewpoint to the deliberations of the Board. Dr. Phillips has been designated an Audit Committee financial expert.</font></div>
</td>

<div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">66</font></div>

<td align="center" valign="top" width="73%">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Mr. Rogel was elected Chairman of the Board of Weyerhaeuser Company, a forest products company, in 1999 and was President and Chief Executive Officer and a director thereof from December 1997 to January 1, 2008 when he relinquished the role of President. He relinquished the CEO role in April of 2008 and retired as Chairman as of April 2009. Before that time Mr. Rogel was Chief Executive Officer, President and a director of Willamette Industries, Inc. He served as Chief Operating Officer of Willamette Industries, Inc. until October 1995 and, before that time, as an executive and group vice president for more than five years. Mr. Rogel is a director of Union Pacific Corporation and Energy</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Solutions</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">, Inc. <div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Mr. Rogel has extensive experience in management of large corporations at all levels. He brings to the Board a unique perspective, having led a national supplier of paper products prior to his retirement. Mr. Rogel previously served as Kroger&#8217;s Lead Director, and has served on compensation, finance, audit, and governance committees of other corporations.</font></div>

In addition to serving as a director of Staples, Mr. Sargent is a director of Mattel, Inc., but has announced that he will not stand for re-election at Mattel&#8217;s 2011 annual meeting of shareholders. He has been nominated to stand for election to the Board of The Home Depot, Inc., at that company&#8217;s annual meeting of shareholders to be held on June 2, 2011. Mr. Sargent has been designated an Audit Committee financial expert.</font></div>
