</td>
<td align="center" valign="top" width="73%">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Until the merger of Burlington Resources Inc. and ConocoPhillips, which became effective in 2006, Mr. Shackouls was Chairman of the Board of Burlington Resources Inc., a natural resources business, since July 1997 and its President and Chief Executive Officer since December 1995. He had been a director of that company since 1995 and President and Chief Executive Officer of Burlington Resources Oil and Gas Company (formerly known as Meridian Oil Inc.), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Burlington Resources, since 1994. Mr. Shackouls is a director of ConocoPhillips and of PNGS GP LLC, the general partner of PAA Natural Gas Storage, L.P. He has been appointed by Kroger&#8217;s Board to serve as Lead Director. Mr. Shackouls is chair of the Corporate Governance Committee and a member of the Audit Committee.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Mr. Shackouls brings to the Board the critical thinking that comes with a chemical engineering background. His guidance of a major natural resources company, coupled with his corporate governance expertise, forms the foundation of his leadership role on Kroger&#8217;s Board.</font></div>
</td>
<td align="center" valign="top" width="2%">
<div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">60</font></div>
</td>
<td align="center" valign="top" width="5%">
<div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">1999</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

____________________<br>
&#160;<br>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
<td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></td>
<td align="left" width="100%">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Except as noted, each of the directors has been employed by his or her present employer (or a subsidiary) in an executive capacity for at least five years.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">16</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Information Concerning the Board of Directors</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Committees of the Board</font></font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board of Directors has a number of standing committees including Audit, Compensation, and Corporate Governance Committees. All standing committees are composed exclusively of independent directors. All Board committees have charters that can be found on our corporate website at www.thekrogerco.com under </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">. During 2010, the Audit Committee met five times, the Compensation Committee met five times, and the Corporate Governance Committee met two times. Committee memberships are shown on pages 9 through 16 of this Proxy Statement. The Audit Committee reviews financial reporting and accounting matters pursuant to its charter and selects our independent accountants. The Compensation Committee recommends for determination by the independent members of our Board the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer, determines the compensation of Kroger&#8217;s other senior management, and administers some of our incentive programs. Additional information on the Compensation Committee&#8217;s processes and procedures for consideration of executive compensation are addressed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis below. The Corporate Governance Committee develops criteria for selecting and retaining members of the Board, seeks out qualified candidates for the Board, and reviews the performance of Kroger, the Board, and along with the other independent board members, the CEO.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Corporate Governance Committee will consider shareholder recommendations for nominees for membership on the Board of Directors. Recommendations relating to our annual meeting in June 2012, together with a description of the proposed nominee&#8217;s qualifications, background and experience, must be submitted in writing to Paul W. Heldman, Secretary, and received at our executive offices not later than January 13, 2012. The shareholder also should indicate the number of shares beneficially owned by the shareholder. The Secretary will forward the information to the Corporate Governance Committee for its consideration. The Committee will use the same criteria in evaluating candidates submitted by shareholders as it uses in evaluating candidates identified by the Committee. These criteria are:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Demonstrated ability in fields considered to be of value in the deliberations of the Board, including</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">business management, public service, education, science, law, and government;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Highest standards of personal character and conduct;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Willingness to fulfill the obligations of directors and to make the contribution of which he or she</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">is capable, including regular attendance and participation at Board and committee meetings, and</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">preparation for all meetings, including review of all meeting materials provided in advance of the</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">meeting; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Ability to understand the perspectives of Kroger&#8217;s customers, taking into consideration the diversity</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">of our customers, including regional and geographic differences.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Racial, ethnic, and gender diversity is an important element in promoting full, open, and balanced deliberations of issues presented to the Board, and is considered by the Corporate Governance Committee. Some consideration also is given to the geographic location of director candidates in order to provide a reasonable distribution of members from the operating areas of the Company.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Corporate Governance Committee typically recruits candidates for Board membership through its own efforts and through suggestions from other directors and shareholders. The Committee on occasion has retained an outside search firm to assist in identifying and recruiting Board candidates who meet the criteria established by the Committee.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">17</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Corporate Governance</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board of Directors has adopted </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">. These </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">, which include copies of the current charters for the Audit, Compensation, and Corporate Governance Committees, and the other committees of the Board of Directors, are available on our corporate website at www.thekrogerco.com. Shareholders may obtain a copy of the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> by making a written request to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at our executive offices.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Independence</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board of Directors has determined that all of the directors, with the exception of Messrs. Dillon and McMullen, have no material relationships with Kroger and therefore are independent for purposes of the New York Stock Exchange listing standards. The Board made its determination based on information furnished by all members regarding their relationships with Kroger. After reviewing the information, the Board determined that all of the non-employee directors were independent because (i) they all satisfied the independence standards set forth in Rule 10A-3 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, (ii) they all satisfied the criteria for independence set forth in Rule 303A.02 of the New York Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual, and (iii) other than business transactions between Kroger and entities with which the directors are affiliated, the value of which falls below the thresholds identified by the New York Stock Exchange listing standards, none had any material relationships with us except for those arising directly from their performance of services as a director for Kroger.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Lead Director</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Lead Director presides over all executive sessions of the non-management directors, serves as the principal liaison between the non-management directors and management, and consults with the Chairman regarding information to be sent to the Board, meeting agendas, and establishing meeting schedules. Unless otherwise determined by the Board, the chair of the Corporate Governance Committee is designated as the Lead Director.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Audit Committee Expertise</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board of Directors has determined that Susan M. Phillips and Ronald L. Sargent, independent directors who are members of the Audit Committee, are &#8220;audit committee financial experts&#8221; as defined by applicable SEC regulations and that all members of the Audit Committee are &#8220;financially literate&#8221; as that term is used in the NYSE listing standards.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Code of Ethics</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board of Directors has adopted </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Kroger Co. Policy on Business Ethics</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">, applicable to all officers, employees and members of the Board of Directors, including Kroger&#8217;s principal executive, financial, and accounting officers. The </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Policy</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> is available on our corporate website at www.thekrogerco.com. Shareholders may obtain a copy of the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Policy</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> by making a written request to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at our executive offices.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Communications with the Board</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board has established two separate mechanisms for shareholders and interested parties to communicate with the Board. Any shareholder or interested party who has concerns regarding accounting, improper use of Kroger assets, or ethical improprieties may report these concerns via the </font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">18</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">toll-free hotline (800-689-4609) or email address (helpline@kroger.com) established by the Board&#8217;s Audit Committee. The concerns are investigated by Kroger&#8217;s Vice President of Auditing and reported to the Audit Committee as deemed appropriate by the Vice President of Auditing.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Shareholders or interested parties also may communicate with the Board in writing directed to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at our executive offices. The Secretary will consider the nature of the communication and determine whether to forward the communication to the chair of the Corporate Governance Committee. Communications relating to personnel issues or our ordinary business operations, or seeking to do business with us, will be forwarded to the business unit of Kroger that the Secretary deems appropriate. All other communications will be forwarded to the chair of the Corporate Governance Committee for further consideration. The chair of the Corporate Governance Committee will take such action as he or she deems appropriate, which may include referral to the Corporate Governance Committee or the entire Board.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Attendance</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board of Directors met five times in 2010. During 2010, all incumbent directors attended at least 75% of the aggregate number of meetings of the Board and committees on which that director served. Members of the Board are expected to use their best efforts to attend all annual meetings of shareholders. All fourteen</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">members of the Board attended last year&#8217;s annual meeting.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Compensation Consultants</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Compensation Committee directly engages a compensation consultant from Mercer Human Resource Consulting to advise the Committee in the design of compensation for executive officers. In 2010, Kroger paid that consultant $230,156 for work performed for the Committee. Kroger, on management&#8217;s recommendation, retained the parent and affiliated companies of Mercer Human Resource Consulting to provide other services for Kroger in 2010, for which Kroger paid $3,668,485. These other services primarily related to insurance claims (for which Kroger was reimbursed by insurance carriers as claims were adjusted), insurance brokerage and bonding commissions, and pension consulting. Kroger also made payments to affiliated companies for insurance premiums that were collected by the affiliated companies on behalf of insurance carriers, but these amounts are not included in the totals referenced above, as the amounts were paid over to insurance carriers for services provided by those carriers. Although neither the Committee nor the Board expressly approved the other services, the Committee determined that the consultant is independent because (a) he was first engaged by the Committee before he became associated with Mercer; (b) he works exclusively for the Committee and not for our management; (c) he does not benefit from the other work that Mercer&#8217;s parent and affiliated companies perform for Kroger; and (d) neither the consultant nor the consultant&#8217;s team perform any other services on behalf of Kroger.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Board Oversight of Enterprise Risk</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>While risk management is primarily the responsibility of Kroger&#8217;s management team, the Board of Directors is responsible for the overall supervision of our risk management activities. The Board&#8217;s oversight of the material risks faced by Kroger occurs at both the full Board level and at the committee level.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">19</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board&#8217;s Audit Committee has oversight responsibility not only for financial reporting of Kroger&#8217;s major financial exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control those exposures, but also for the effectiveness of management&#8217;s processes that monitor and manage key business risks facing Kroger, as well as the major areas of risk exposure and management&#8217;s efforts to monitor and control that exposure. The Audit Committee also discusses with management its policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Management provides regular updates throughout the year to the respective committees regarding the management of the risks they oversee, and each of these committees reports on risk to the full Board at each regular meeting of the Board.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In addition to the reports from the committees, the Board receives presentations throughout the year from various department and business unit leaders that include discussion of significant risks as necessary. At each Board meeting, the Chairman and CEO addresses matters of particular importance or concern, including any significant areas of risk that require Board attention. Additionally, through dedicated sessions focusing entirely on corporate strategy, the full Board reviews in detail Kroger&#8217;s short- and long-term strategies, including consideration of significant risks facing Kroger and their potential impact. The independent directors, in executive sessions led by the Lead Director, address matters of particular concern, including significant areas of risk, that warrant further discussion or consideration outside the presence of Kroger employees.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We believe that our approach to risk oversight, as described above, optimizes our ability to assess inter-relationships among the various risks, make informed cost-benefit decisions, and approach emerging risks in a proactive manner for Kroger. We also believe that our risk structure complements our current Board leadership structure, as it allows our independent directors, through the five fully independent Board committees, and in executive sessions of independent directors led by an independent Lead Director, to exercise effective oversight of the actions of management, led by Mr. Dillon as Chairman and CEO, in identifying risks and implementing effective risk management policies and controls.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Board Leadership Structure</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Our Board is composed of twelve independent directors and two management directors, Mr. Dillon, the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer, and Mr. McMullen, President and Chief Operating Officer. In addition, as provided in our </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">, the Board has designated one of the independent directors as Lead Director. The Board has established five standing committees &#8212; audit, compensation, corporate governance, financial policy, and public responsibilities. Each of the Board committees is composed solely of independent directors, each with a different independent director serving as committee chair. We believe that the mix of experienced independent and management directors that make up our Board, along with the independent role of our Lead Director and our independent Board committees, benefits Kroger and its shareholders.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Board believes that it is beneficial to Kroger and its shareholders to designate one of the directors as a Lead Director. The Lead Director serves a variety of roles, including reviewing and approving Board agendas, meeting materials and schedules to confirm the appropriate topics are reviewed and sufficient time is allocated to each; serving as liaison between the Chairman of the Board, management, and the non-management directors; presiding at the executive sessions of independent directors and at all other meetings of the Board of Directors at which the Chairman of the Board is not present; and calling an executive session of independent directors at any time. Bobby Shackouls, an independent director and the chair of the Corporate Governance Committee, is currently our Lead Director. Mr. Shackouls is an effective Lead Director for Kroger due to, among other things, his independence, his deep strategic and operational </font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">20</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">understanding of Kroger obtained while serving as a Kroger director, his corporate governance knowledge acquired during his tenure as a member of our Corporate Governance Committee, his previous experience on other boards, and his prior experience as a CEO of a Fortune 500 company.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>With respect to the roles of Chairman and CEO, the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> provide that the Board believes that it is in the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders for one person to serve as Chairman and CEO. The Board recognizes that there may be circumstances in which it is in the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders for the roles to be separated, and the Board exercises its discretion as it deems appropriate in light of prevailing circumstances. The Board believes that the combination or separation of these positions should continue to be considered as part of the succession planning process, as was the case in 2003 when the roles were separated. Since 2004, the roles have been combined.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Our Board and each of its committees conduct an annual evaluation to determine whether they are functioning effectively. As part of this annual self-evaluation, the Board assesses whether the current leadership structure continues to be appropriate for Kroger and its shareholders. Our </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"> provide the flexibility for our Board to modify our leadership structure in the future as appropriate. We believe that Kroger, like many U.S. companies, has been well-served by this flexible leadership structure.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">21</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr>
<td align="left" nowrap width="99%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid">
<div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Compensation Discussion and Analysis</font></font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

<br>
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Executive Compensation &#8211; Overview</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>As the largest traditional food and drug retailer in the United States, our executive compensation philosophy is to attract and retain the best management talent and to motivate these employees to achieve business and financial goals that create value for shareholders in a manner consistent with our focus on our core values: honesty, integrity, respect, inclusion, diversity, and safety.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>To achieve our objectives, our Compensation Committee seeks to ensure that compensation is competitive and that there is a direct link between pay and performance, using the following guiding principles:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A significant portion of pay should be performance-based, with the proportion varying with an</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">executive&#8217;s level of responsibility;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Compensation should include incentive-based pay to drive performance, providing superior pay for</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">superior performance, with both a short- and long-term focus;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Compensation policies should include an opportunity for and a requirement of equity</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ownership; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Components of compensation should be tied to an evaluation of business and individual performance</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">measured against metrics that align with our business strategy.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Our 2010 fiscal year results compared against the compensation of senior executives demonstrated these principles, and illustrated how our compensation program responds to business challenges and the marketplace. While many companies have struggled unsuccessfully during this difficult economy, we have continued to deliver sales growth and positive earnings results.</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our identical supermarket sales, excluding fuel, increased 2.8% compared to 2009. This result was</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">substantially better than most of our competitors&#8217; sales growth but still fell short of our objectives.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our earnings per diluted share were $1.74, including an impairment charge that reduced earnings by</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">approximately $0.02 per diluted share. Again, these results were laudable in the challenging operating</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">environment of 2010 but below our objectives.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Annual cash dividends declared per common share during the year increased 8% over 2009.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As described below, short-term performance-based compensation, or annual cash bonus, of 53.868%</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">of bonus potentials paid to the named executive officers, was substantially lower than the average</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">of 74% over the prior nine years, but higher than the 38.450% paid in 2009. This reflects the extent</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">to which Kroger was able to achieve increasingly more challenging targets for sales, earnings, our</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">strategic plan, and our fuel program, as well as year-over-year improvement from 2009.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Beginning in 2010, fifty percent of the time-based equity awards that otherwise would have been</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">granted to the named executive officers as restricted stock have been replaced with performance</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">units that are earned only to the extent that performance objectives are achieved.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Equity compensation awards continued to play an important role in rewarding named executive</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">officers for the achievement of long-term business objectives and providing incentives for the creation</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">of shareholder value.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">22</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In sum, the Committee believes our management produced outstanding results in 2010, but we did not achieve our aggressive business plan objectives for sales, earnings, and our strategic plan. The compensation paid to our named executive officers reflected this fact as the performance-based cash bonus paid out at 53.868% of bonus potentials. Further, the equity-based portion, the value of which is tied to the return received by our shareholders in the stock market, grew in value only modestly during 2010. This is shown in the performance graph appearing at page A-3 of the accompanying annual report.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In keeping with our overall compensation philosophy, we endeavor to ensure that our compensation practices conform to best practices when identified. In particular, over the past several years we have:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">put in place significant stock ownership guideline levels to reinforce the link between the interests</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">of our named executive officers and those of our shareholders;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">adopted claw-back policies under which the repayment of bonuses may be required in certain</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">circumstances; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">eliminated tax gross-ups.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Compensation Committee of the Board has the primary responsibility for establishing the compensation of Kroger&#8217;s executive officers, including the named executive officers, with the exception of the Chief Executive Officer. The Committee&#8217;s role regarding the CEO&#8217;s compensation is to make recommendations to the independent members of the Board; those independent Board members establish the CEO&#8217;s compensation.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The following discussion and analysis addresses the compensation of the named executive officers, and the factors considered by the Committee in setting compensation for the named executive officers and making recommendations to the independent Board members in the case of the CEO&#8217;s compensation. Additional detail is provided in the compensation tables and the accompanying narrative disclosures that follow this discussion and analysis.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Executive Compensation &#8211; Objectives</font></font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Committee has several related objectives regarding compensation. First, the Committee believes that compensation must be designed to attract and retain those best suited to fulfill the challenging roles that executive officers play at Kroger. Second, some elements of compensation should help align the interests of the officers with your interests as shareholders. Third, compensation should create strong incentives for the officers (a) to achieve the annual business plan targets established by the Board, and (b) to ensure that the officers achieve Kroger&#8217;s long-term strategic objectives. In developing compensation programs and amounts to meet these objectives, the Committee exercises judgment to ensure that executive officer compensation is appropriate and competitive in light of Kroger&#8217;s performance and the needs of the business.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>To meet these objectives, the Committee has taken a number of steps over the last several years, including the following:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Consulted regularly with its independent advisor from Mercer Human Resource Consulting on the</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">design of compensation plans and on the amount of compensation that is necessary and appropriate</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">for Kroger&#8217;s senior leaders in light of the Committee&#8217;s objectives. In 2009, the Committee retained a</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">second independent consultant to determine whether the compensation plans and amounts comport</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">with the Committee&#8217;s objectives and produce value for Kroger&#8217;s shareholders.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">23</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Conducted an annual review of all components of compensation, quantifying total compensation</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">for the named executive officers on tally sheets. The review includes an assessment for each named</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">executive officer, including the CEO, of salary; performance-based cash compensation, or bonus (both</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">annual and long-term); equity; accumulated realized and unrealized stock option gains and restricted</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">stock and performance unit values; the value of any perquisites; retirement benefits; severance</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">benefits available under The Kroger Co. Employee Protection Plan; and earnings and payouts available</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">under Kroger&#8217;s nonqualified deferred compensation program.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Considered internal pay equity at Kroger. The Committee is aware of reported concerns at other</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">companies regarding disproportionate compensation awards to chief executive officers. The</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Committee has assured itself that the compensation of Kroger&#8217;s CEO and that of the other named</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">executive officers bears a reasonable relationship to the compensation levels of other executive</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">positions at Kroger taking into consideration performance and differences in responsibilities.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Recommended share ownership guidelines, adopted by the Board of Directors. These guidelines</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">require directors, officers and some other key executives to acquire and hold a minimum dollar value</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">of Kroger stock. The guidelines require the CEO to acquire and maintain ownership of Kroger shares</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">equal to 5 times his base salary; the Chief Operating Officer at 4 times his base salary; Executive Vice</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Presidents, Senior Vice Presidents and non-employee directors at 3 times their base salaries or annual</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">base cash retainers; and other officers and key executives at 2 times their base salaries.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Establishing Executive Compensation</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The independent members of the Board have the exclusive authority to determine the amount of the CEO&#8217;s salary; the bonus potential for the CEO; the nature and amount of any equity awards made to the CEO; and any other compensation questions related to the CEO. In setting the annual bonus potential for the CEO, the independent directors determine the dollar amount that will be multiplied by the percentage payout under the annual bonus plan generally applicable to all corporate management, including the named executive officers. The independent directors retain discretion to reduce the percentage payout the CEO would otherwise receive. The independent directors thus make a separate determination annually concerning both the CEO&#8217;s bonus potential and the percentage of bonus paid.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Committee performs the same function and exercises the same authority as to the other named executive officers. The Committee&#8217;s annual review of compensation for the named executive officers includes the following:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A detailed report, by officer, that describes current compensation, the value of equity compensation</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">previously awarded, the value of retirement benefits earned, and any severance or other benefits</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">payable upon a change of control.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">An internal equity comparison of compensation at various senior levels. This current and historical</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">analysis is undertaken to ensure that the relationship of CEO compensation to other senior officer</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">compensation, and senior officer compensation to other levels in the organization, is equitable.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A report from the Committee&#8217;s compensation consultants (described below) comparing named</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">executive officer and other senior executive compensation with that of other companies, primarily</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">our competitors, to ensure that the Committee&#8217;s objectives of competitiveness are met.<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A recommendation from the CEO (except in the case of his own compensation) for salary, bonus</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">potential, and equity awards for each of the senior officers including the other named executive</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">officers. The CEO&#8217;s recommendation takes into consideration the objectives established by and the</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">reports received by the Committee as well as his assessment of individual job performance and</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">contribution to our management team.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">24</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Historical information regarding salary, bonus and equity compensation for a 3-year period.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In considering each of the factors above, the Committee does not make use of a formula, but rather subjectively reviews each in making its compensation determination.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">The Committee&#8217;s Compensation Consultants and Benchmarking</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>As referenced earlier in this proxy statement, the Committee directly engages a compensation consultant from Mercer Human Resource Consulting to advise the Committee in the design of compensation for executive officers.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Mercer consultant conducts an annual competitive assessment of executive positions at Kroger for the Committee. The assessment is one of several bases, as described above, on which the Committee determines compensation. The consultant assesses:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Base salary;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Target annual performance-based bonus;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Target cash compensation (the sum of salary and bonus);<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Annualized long-term incentive awards, such as stock options, restricted shares, and performance-</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">based long-term cash bonuses and performance-based equity awards; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Total direct compensation (the sum of all these elements).<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The consultant compares these elements against those of other companies in a group of publicly-</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">traded food and drug retailers. For 2010, the group consisted of:</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="center">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="60%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Costco Wholesale</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Supervalu</font></td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">CVS</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Target</font></td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Great Atlantic &amp; Pacific Tea</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Walgreens</font></td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Rite Aid</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Wal-Mart</font></td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Safeway</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="50%">&#160;</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<br>
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">This peer group is the same group as was used in 2009.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The make-up of the compensation peer group is reviewed annually and modified as circumstances warrant. Industry consolidation and other competitive forces will change the peer group used over time. The consultant also provides the Committee data from companies in &#8220;general industry,&#8221; a representation of major publicly-traded companies. These data are reference points, particularly for senior staff positions where competition for talent extends beyond the retail sector.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In 2009, the Committee directly engaged an additional compensation consultant to conduct a review of Kroger&#8217;s executive compensation. This consultant, from Frederic W. Cook &amp; Co., Inc., examined the compensation philosophy, peer group composition, annual cash bonus, and long-term incentive compensation including equity awards. The consultant concluded that Kroger&#8217;s executive compensation program met the Committee&#8217;s objectives, and that it provides a strong linkage between pay and performance. The Committee expects to engage an additional compensation consultant from time to time as it deems advisable.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">25</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Kroger is the second-largest company as measured by annual revenues when compared with the peer group referenced above and is the largest traditional food and drug retailer. The Committee has therefore sought to ensure that salaries paid to our executive officers are at or above the median paid by competitors for comparable positions and to provide an annual bonus potential to our executive officers that, if annual business plan objectives are achieved, would cause their total cash compensation to be meaningfully above the median.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Components of Executive Compensation at Kroger</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Compensation for our named executive officers is comprised of the following:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Salary;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Performance-Based Annual Cash Bonus (annual, non-equity incentive pay);<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Performance-Based Long-Term Cash Bonus (long-term, non-equity incentive pay);<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Equity, including performance-based equity;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Retirement and other benefits; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Perquisites.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Salary</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We provide our named executive officers and other employees a fixed amount of cash compensation &#8211; salary &#8211; for their work. Salaries for named executive officers (with the exception of the CEO) are established each year by the Committee. The CEO&#8217;s salary is established by the independent directors. Salaries for the named executive officers were reviewed in June.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The amount of each executive&#8217;s salary is influenced by numerous factors including:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">An assessment of individual contribution in the judgment of the CEO and the Committee (or, in the</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">case of the CEO, of the Committee and the rest of the independent directors);<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Benchmarking with comparable positions at peer group companies;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Tenure; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Relationship with the salaries of other executives at Kroger.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The assessment of individual contribution is based on a subjective determination, without the use of performance targets, in the following areas:</font></div>

<ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Leadership;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Contribution to the officer group;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Achievement of established objectives, to the extent applicable;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Decision-making abilities;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Performance of the areas or groups directly reporting to the officer;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Increased responsibilities;<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Strategic thinking; and<br>
&#160;</font> </li>

<li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Furtherance of Kroger&#8217;s core values.</font> </li>
</ul>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">26</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The amounts shown below reflect the salaries of the named executive officers in effect following the annual review of their compensation in June of each year.</font></div>

</tr></table>

<br>
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-VARIANT: small-caps"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Performance-Based Annual Cash Bonus</font></font></font></div>

<div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>A large percentage of our employees at all levels, including the named executive officers, are eligible to receive a performance-based annual cash bonus based on Kroger or unit performance. The Committee establishes bonus potentials for each executive officer, other than the CEO whose bonus potential is established by the independent directors. Actual payouts, which can exceed 100% of the potential amounts, represent the extent to which performance meets or exceeds the thresholds established by the Committee.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The Committee considers several factors in making its determination or recommendation as to bonus potentials. First, the individual&#8217;s level within the organization is a factor in that the Committee believes that more senior executives should have a substantial part of their compensation dependent upon Kroger&#8217;s performance. Second, the individual&#8217;s salary is a factor so that a substantial portion of a named executive officer&#8217;s total cash compensation is dependent upon Kroger&#8217;s performance. Finally, the Committee considers the reports of its compensation consultants to assess the bonus potential of the named executive officers in light of total compensation paid to comparable executive positions in the industry.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The annual cash bonus potential in effect at the end of the year for each named executive officer is shown below. Actual bonus payouts are prorated to reflect changes, if any, to bonus potentials during the year.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="85%">&#160;</td>
<td nowrap width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</td>
<td colspan="8" nowrap width="14%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Annual Bonus Potential</font></font></td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">

<td nowrap width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>

<td align="left" nowrap width="1%">&#160;</td>

<td align="left" nowrap width="1%">&#160;</td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
<td align="right" nowrap width="3%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">550,000</font></td>
</tr><tr valign="bottom">
<td align="left" nowrap width="85%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Paul W. Heldman</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
<td align="right" nowrap width="3%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">550,000</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
<td align="right" nowrap width="3%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">550,000</font></td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
<td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
<td align="right" nowrap width="3%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">550,000</font></td>
</tr></table>

<br>
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The amount of bonus that the named executive officers earn each year is determined by Kroger&#8217;s performance compared to targets established by the Committee based on the business plan adopted by the Board of Directors. In 2010, thirty percent of bonus was earned based on an identical sales target for Kroger&#8217;s supermarkets and other business operations; thirty percent was based on a target for EBITDA, excluding supermarket fuel; and forty percent was based on implementation and results of a set of measures under our strategic plan. An additional 5% would be earned if Kroger achieved three goals with respect to its supermarket fuel operations; achievement of at least 85% of the targeted fuel EBITDA as set forth in the business plan, increase of at least 3% in gallons sold at identical fuel centers, and achievement of the planned number of fuel centers placed in service.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">27</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Over time the Committee has placed an increased emphasis on the strategic plan by making the target more difficult to achieve. The bonus plan allows for minimal bonus to be earned at relatively low levels to provide incentive for achieving even higher levels of performance.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Following the close of the year, the Committee reviewed Kroger&#8217;s performance against the identical sales, EBITDA, and strategic plan objectives and determined the extent to which Kroger achieved those objectives. Kroger&#8217;s EBITDA for 2010 was $3.696 billion, and Kroger&#8217;s identical retail sales for 2010, excluding supermarket fuel, were 2.9%. In 2010, Kroger&#8217;s supermarket fuel EBITDA was $141.967 million, or 122.3% of the goal established at the beginning of the year, exceeding the 85% threshold necessary to earn a bonus for the fuel component. Kroger&#8217;s sale of fuel in identical supermarket fuel centers was 2.972 billion gallons, or 5.0% over the prior year. We operated 1,014 supermarket fuel centers as of the end of 2010, exceeding our goal of 1,000 centers. As a result, the officers earned the additional 5% fuel bonus. As a result of the Company&#8217;s performance when compared to the targets established by the Committee, and based on the business plan adopted by the Board of Directors, the named executive officers earned 53.868% of their bonus potentials, which percentage payout exceeds that of last year but is substantially lower than the bonus payouts over the previous several years. This principally reflects the degree to which Kroger achieved its aggressive EBITDA and sales goals.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The 2010 targets established by the Committee for annual bonus amounts based on identical sales and EBITDA results, the actual 2010 results, and the bonus percentage earned in each of the components of named executive officer bonus, were as follows:</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font size="3" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In 2010, as in all years, the Committee retained discretion to reduce the bonus payout for all executive officers, including the named executive officers, if the Committee determined for any reason that the bonus payouts were not appropriate. The independent directors retained that discretion for the CEO&#8217;s bonus. Those bodies also retained discretion to adjust the targets under the plan should unanticipated developments arise during the year. No adjustments were made to the targets. Participants under the corporate plan, with the exception of the named executive officers, received a total bonus percentage payout that was 1.128% greater than the payout to the named executive officers due to adjustments made to the non-officer payouts.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">28</font></font></div>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<!-- Part C -->

<div id="PGBRK">
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&#160;</div>
</div>

<br>
<div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
<div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The percentage paid for 2010 represented and resulted from performance that, due to a weak economy and persistent deflation, did not meet our original business plan objectives. A comparison of bonus percentages for the named executive officers in prior years demonstrates the variability of incentive compensation:</font></div>
